Attributes

Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_RANGE_CHECK
Description Name: Range Check
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to validate attribute values and function parameters. If enabled, the instrument driver validates the parameter values that you pass to driver functions. Range checking parameters is very useful for debugging. After you validate your program, you can set this attribute to VI_FALSE to disable range checking and maximize performance.
The default value is VI_TRUE. Use the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050002
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_QUERY_INSTRUMENT_STATUS
Description Name: Query Instrument Status
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether the instrument driver queries the instrument status after each operation. Querying the instrument status is very useful for debugging. After you validate your program, you can set this attribute to VI_FALSE to disable status checking and maximize performance
The instrument driver can choose to ignore status checking for particular attributes regardless of the setting of this attribute.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050003
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_CACHE
Description Name: Cache
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to cache the value of attributes. When caching is enabled, the instrument driver keeps track of the current instrument settings and avoids sending redundant commands to the instrument. Thus, you can significantly increase execution speed.
The instrument driver can choose always to cache or never to cache particular attributes regardless of the setting of this attribute.
The default value is VI_TRUE. Use the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050004
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SIMULATE
Description Name: Simulate
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether or not to simulate instrument driver I/O operations. If simulation is enabled, instrument driver functions perform range checking and call Ivi_GetAttribute and Ivi_SetAttribute functions, but they do not perform instrument I/O. For output parameters that represent instrument data, the instrument driver functions return calculated values.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050005
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_RECORD_COERCIONS
Description Name: Record Value Coercions
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether the IVI engine keeps a list of the value coercions it makes for integer and real type attributes. You call tkafg31k Get Next Coercion Record to extract and delete the oldest coercion record from the list.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050006
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_INTERCHANGE_CHECK
Description Name: Interchange Check
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to perform interchangeability checking and retrieve interchangeability warnings.

The default value is VI_FALSE.

Interchangeability warnings indicate that using your application with a different instrument might cause different behavior. You call tkafg31k Get Next Interchange Warning to extract interchange warnings. Call the tkafg31k_ClearInterchangeWarnings function to clear the list of interchangeability warnings without reading them.
Interchangeability checking logs a warning for each attribute you have not set that affects the behavior of the instrument.

Attribute Value: 1050021
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_DESCRIPTION
Description Name: Description
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains a brief description of the specific driver.

Attribute Value: 1050514
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_PREFIX
Description Name: Driver Prefix
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the prefix for the instrument driver. The name of each user-callable function in this driver starts with this prefix.

Attribute Value: 1050302
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_VENDOR
Description Name: Driver Vendor
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the name of the vendor that supplies this driver.

Attribute Value: 1050513
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_REVISION
Description Name: Revision
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains additional version information about this instrument driver.

Attribute Value: 1050551
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_CLASS_SPEC_MAJOR_VERSION
Description Name: Class Specification Major Version
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: The major version number of the class specification with which this driver is compliant.

Attribute Value: 1050515
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_CLASS_SPEC_MINOR_VERSION
Description Name: Class Specification Minor Version
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: The minor version number of the class specification with which this driver is compliant.

Attribute Value: 1050516
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SUPPORTED_INSTRUMENT_MODELS
Description Name: Supported Instrument Models
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Contains a model code of the instrument. For drivers that support more than one device, this attribute contains a comma-separated list of supported instrument models.

Attribute Value: 1050327
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_GROUP_CAPABILITIES
Description Name: Class Group Capabilities
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains a comma-separated list of class-extension groups that this driver implements.

Attribute Value: 1050401
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_CHANNEL_COUNT
Description Name: Number of Channels
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Indicates the number of channels that the specific instrument driver supports.
For each attribute for which the IVI_VAL_MULTI_CHANNEL flag attribute is set, the IVI engine maintains a separate cache value for each channel.

Attribute Value: 1050203
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_MANUFACTURER
Description Name: Manufacturer
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the name of the instrument manufacturer you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050511
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_MODEL
Description Name: Model
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the model number or name of the instrument that you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050512
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_FIRMWARE_REVISION
Description Name: Firmware Revision
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the firmware revision information for the instrument you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050510
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_LOGICAL_NAME
Description Name: Logical Name
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string containing the logical name you specified when opening the current IVI session.
You may pass a logical name to the tkafg31k_init or tkafg31k_InitWithOptions functions. The IVI Configuration utility must contain an entry for the logical name. The logical name entry refers to a virtual instrument section in the IVI Configuration file. The virtual instrument section specifies a physical device and initial user options.

Attribute Value: 1050305
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR
Description Name: I/O Resource Descriptor
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Indicates the resource descriptor the driver uses to identify the physical device.
If you initialize the driver with a logical name, this attribute contains the resource descriptor that corresponds to the entry in the IVI Configuration utility.
If you initialize the instrument driver with the resource descriptor, this attribute contains that value.

Attribute Value: 1050304
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_DRIVER_SETUP
Description Name: Driver Setup
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Some cases exist where you must specify instrument driver options at initialization time. An example of this is specifying a particular instrument model from among a family of instruments that the driver supports. This is useful when using simulation. You can specify driver-specific options through the DriverSetup keyword in the optionsString parameter to the tkafg31k_InitWithOptions function. If you open an instrument using a logical name, you can also specify the options through the IVI Configuration Utility.
The default value is an empty string.

Attribute Value: 1050007
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_ACTIVE_CHANNEL
Description Name: Active Channel
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies current active channel.

Attribute Value: 1153014
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_OPERATION_MODE
Description Name: Operation Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrOperationModeRangeTable
Description: This channel-based attribute determines how the function generator produces waveforms.

When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_CONTINUOUS, the function generator continuously produces an output signal.

When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_MODULATION, the function generator use a certain method to modulate output signal. Current instrument driver support the following modulation types:
- AM ( Amplitude Modulation )
- FM ( Frequency Modulation )
- PM ( Phase Modulation )
- FSK ( Frequency Shift Key Modulation )
- PWM ( Pulse Width Modulation )

When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_SWEEP, you set the instrument to sweep mode. You could use the following function to configure sweep mode parameters.

- tkafg31k_ConfigureSweep
- tkafg31k_ConfigureSweepEx

In place of using this function, you can set the following attributes:
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_START_FREQUENCY
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_STOP_FREQUENCY
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_HOLD_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_RETURN_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_TYPE

When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_BURST, you set the instrument to burst mode. You could use the following function to configure burst mode attributes:

- tkafg31k_ConfigureBurstCount
- tkafg31k_ConfigureBurstMode

Attribute Value: 1250005
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE
Description Name: Output Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrOutputModeRangeTable
Description: Determines the kind of waveform the function generator produces. The value you specify determines which functions and attributes you use to configure the waveform the function generator produces.
When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC, you use the following function to configure the waveform:

- tkafg31k_ConfigureStandardWaveform
- tkafg31k_ConfigureRampSymmetry
- tkafg31k_ConfigurePulseWaveform
- tkafg31k_ConfigurePulseDelay

In place of using this function, you can set the following attributes:

- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_AMPLITUDE
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_DC_OFFSET
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_FREQUENCY
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_START_PHASE
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_DUTY_CYCLE_HIGH
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_RAMP_SYMMETRY
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_PULSE_DUTY_CYCLE
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_PULSE_LEAD_DELAY
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_PULSE_PERIOD
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_PULSE_LEADING_TIME
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_PULSE_TRAILING_TIME

When you set this parameter to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_ARB, you use the following functions to configure the waveform:

- tkafg31k_QueryArbWfmCapabilities
- tkafg31k_CreateArbWaveform
- tkafg31k_ClearArbWaveform
- tkafg31k_ConfigureSampleRate
- tkafg31k_ConfigureArbWaveform

In place of using the tkafg31k_ConfigureSampleRate and tkafg31k_ConfigureArbWaveform functions, you can set the following attributes:

- TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_WAVEFORM_HANDLE
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_GAIN
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_OFFSET
- TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_SAMPLE_RATE

Attribute Value: 1250001
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_REF_CLOCK_SOURCE
Description Name: Ref Clock Source
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrRefClockSourceRangeTable
Description: Specifies the reference clock source. The function generator derives frequencies and sample rates that it uses to generate waveforms from the source you specify.
For example, when you set this attribute to TKAFG31K_VAL_EXTERNAL, the function generator uses the signal it receives at its external clock terminal as its reference clock.

Attribute Value: 1250002
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_ENABLED
Description Name: Output Enabled
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies whether the signal the function generator produces appears at the output connector.

SCPI Command:
OUTPut[1|2][:STATe] [ON|OFF]
Attribute Value: 1250003
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_IMPEDANCE
Description Name: Output Impedance
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the function generator's output impedance at the output connector. A value of 0.0 indicates that the function generator is in the impedance of INFINITY, or you can use defined macro TKAFG31K_VAL_IMPEDANCE_INFINITY instead.

SCPI Command:
OUTPut[1|2]:IMPedance

Attribute Value: 1250004
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM
Description Name: Waveform
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrFuncWaveformRangeTable
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies which standard waveform the function generator produces.
You use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:FUNCtion[:SHAPe]
{SINusoid|SQUare|PULSe|RAMP|PRNoise|DC|SINC|GAUSsian|LORentz|ERISe|EDECay|HAVersine|USER[1]|USER2|USER3|USER4|EMEMory[1]|EMEMory2|EFILe}

Attribute Value: 1250101
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_AMPLITUDE
Description Name: Amplitude
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the amplitude of the standard waveform the function generator produces. This value is the amplitude at the output terminal. The units are volts peak-to-peak (Vpp). For example, to produce a waveform ranging from -5.0 to +5.0 volts, you set this value to 10.0 volts.
You use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC. This attribute does not affect function generator behavior when you set the TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM attribute to TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_DC.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:VOLTage[:LEVel][:IMMediate][:AMPLitude]
Attribute Value: 1250102
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_DC_OFFSET
Description Name: DC Offset
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the DC offset of the standard waveform the function generator produces. This value is the offset at the output terminal. The units are volts (V). The value is the offset from ground to the center of the waveform you specify with the TKAFG3K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM attribute. For example, a standard waveform ranging from +5.0 volts to 0.0 volts has a DC offset of 2.5 volts.
You use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:VOLTage[:LEVel][:IMMediate]:OFFSet

Attribute Value: 1250103
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_FREQUENCY
Description Name: Frequency
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the frequency of the standard waveform the function generator produces. The units are hertz (Hz). You use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC.
This attribute does not affect function generator behavior when you set the TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM attribute to TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_DC or TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_PRN.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:FREQuency[:CW|:FIXed]

Attribute Value: 1250104
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_START_PHASE
Description Name: Start Phase
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the horizontal offset of the standard waveform the function generator produces. You specify this attribute in degrees of one waveform cycle. For example, a 180 degree phase offset means output generation begins half way through the waveform. A start phase of 360 degrees offsets the output by an entire waveform cycle. It is therefore identical to a start phase of 0 degrees.
You use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC. This attribute does not affect function generator behavior when you set the TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_WAVEFORM attribute to TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_DC or TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_PRN.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:PHASe[:ADJust]

Attribute Value: 1250105
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_RAMP_SYMMETRY
Description Name: Ramp Symmetry
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the symmetry of ramp waveform. The units are percentage(%). With different ramp symmetry, the ramp waveform changes. When you specify ramp symmetry to 0%, the waveform appears as ramp down. And it appears as triangle when ramp symmetry is 50%, ramp up when ramp symmetry is 100%.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:FUNCtion:RAMP:SYMMetry

Attribute Value: 1150003
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_FUNC_DUTY_CYCLE_HIGH
Description Name: Duty Cycle High
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the length of time the output voltage level remains high in a square waveform. You specify this attribute as a percentage of one waveform cycle. The units are percentage (%).
Because the duty cycle of square waveform is fixed in instrument, so you could only set this attribute to 50%.

Attribute Value: 1250201
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_GAIN
Description Name: Arbitrary Waveform Gain
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the factor by which the function generator scales the arbitrary waveform data. When you create arbitrary waveforms, you must first normalize the data points to the range -1.00 to +1.00. You use this attribute to scale the arbitrary waveform to other ranges. For example, when you set this attribute to 1.0, the output signal ranges from -1.0 to +1.0 volts.
You use this attribute when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_ARB .

SCPI Command:

Attribute Value: 1150046
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_ARB_OFFSET
Description Name: Arbitrary Waveform Offset
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the value the function generator adds to the arbitrary waveform data. When you create arbitrary waveforms, you must first normalize the data points to the range -1.0 to +1.0. You use this attribute to shift the arbitrary waveform's range. The units are volts (V). For example, when you set this attribute to 1.0, the output signal ranges from 2.0 volts to 0.0 volts.
You use this attribute when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_OUTPUT_MODE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_ARB.

Attribute Value: 1152025
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SEQUENCE_MODE
Description Name: Sequence Run Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrSequenceModeRangeTable
Description: This attribute specifies which run mode sequence will use.
When TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_CONTINUOUS is selected, there is only one element in each channel. Jump event, jump address, wait event, loop and GOTO event are not valid.
When TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_TRIGGERED is selected, there is only one element in each channel. Jump event, jump address, loop and GOTO event are not valid. You can set wait event for the sequence.
When TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_GATED is selected, there is only one element in each channel. Jump address, loop and GOTO event are not valid. You can set wait event and jump event for the sequence.

SCPI Command:

Description: This attribute specifies the mode for trigger output signal.

When the burst count is set to INFINITY, Sync Output Mode indicates that one pulse waveform is output.

When the burst count is specified other than INFINITY, Trigger Output Mode and Sync Output Mode have the same effect.

[SOURce[1|2]]:SWEep:SPACing {LIN|LOG}

Attribute Value: 1150011
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_TIME
Description Name: Sweep Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the sweep time that you want the function generator to produce. The sweep time does not include hold time and return time.

When you set this attribute, remember that it could change the value of sweep hold time and sweep return time.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:SWEep:TIME

Attribute Value: 1150012
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_MODE
Description Name: Sweep Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrSweepModeRangeTable
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the sweep mode.

When you set this parameter to Auto, and when sweep mode is enabled, the function generator outputs a continuous sweep at a rate specified by Sweep Time, Hold Time, and Return Time.

When you set this parameter to Manual, and when sweep mode is enabled, the function generator outputs one sweep when a trigger input is received.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:SWEep:MODE {AUTO|MANual}

Attribute Value: 1150043
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_START_FREQUENCY
Description Name: Start Frequency
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the start frequency of sweep that you want the function generator to produce.

Notes:
The valid range of start frequency is decided by instrument model and waveform shape.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:FREQuency:STARt

SCPI Command:

Description Name: Append Noise Level
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:

Note:

SCPI Command:

Attribute Value: 1150018

Description: This channel-based attribute specifies whether to add external signal to an output signal.

This attribute is only applicable to CH1. You could add an external signal to the CH1 output signal.
Model Channel Applicable
-----------------------------------------------
AFG31021 CH1 YES
AFG31022 CH1 YES
AFG31022 CH2 NO
AFG31051 CH1 YES
AFG31052 CH1 YES
AFG31052 CH2 NO
AFG31101 CH1 YES
AFG31102 CH1 YES
AFG31102 CH2 NO
AFG31151 CH1 YES
AFG31152 CH1 YES
AFG31152 CH2 NO
AFG31251 CH1 YES
AFG31252 CH1 YES
AFG31252 CH2 NO

SCPI Command:

Attribute Value: 1150019
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_MODULATION_ENABLED
Description Name: Modulation Enabled
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: This channel-based attributes determines whether to enable modulation mode for operation mode. When you enable modulation mode, the function generator applies a certain modulation type to the channel you specify.
If the recently used modulation type get from the TKAFG31K_ATTR_ORIGINAL_MODULATION attribute is applicable for current waveform shape, it is selected as the modulation type. Otherwise, the driver selects an applicable one from all modulation types.

Notes:
(1) It is a hidden attribute, you should not use it directly in user program.
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_ORIGINAL_MODULATION
Description Name: Original Modulation
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrOriginalModulationRangeTable
Description: This attribute records the recently used modulation type.
When you set TKAFG31K_ATTR_MODULATION_ENABLED to VI_TRUE, the driver firstly gets the recently used modulation type from this attribute and considers whether it is applicable.

Notes:
(1) It is a hidden attribute, you should not use it directly in user program.

Attribute Value: 1250402
Const Name: TKAFG31K_ATTR_AM_INTERNAL_DEPTH
Description Name: AM Internal Depth
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the extent of modulation the function generator applies to the carrier signal. The units are a percentage of full modulation. At 0% depth, the output amplitude equals the carrier signal's amplitude. At 100% depth, the output amplitude equals twice the carrier signal's amplitude.
You could use this attribute only when the TKAFG31K_ATTR_AM_SOURCE attribute is set to TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL.

Note:
This attribute is not based on channel.

SCPI Command:
[SOURce[1|2]]:AM[:DEPTh]

RangeTables

attrAMInternalWaveformRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_SINE 1 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a sinusoid waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_SQUARE 2 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a square waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_TRIANGLE 3 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a triangle waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_RAMP_UP 4 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a positive ramp waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_RAMP_DOWN 5 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a negative ramp waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_PRN 1001 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a noise waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_EMEM 1002 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a EMEMory waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_EMEM2 1003 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a EMEMory2 waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL_EFIL 1004 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's amplitude with a Edit File waveform.
attrAMSourceRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_INTERNAL 0 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier waveform with its internal AM Modulating Source.
TKAFG31K_VAL_AM_EXTERNAL 1 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier waveform with its external AM Modulating Source.
attrActiveOneMemoryRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_EMEM 0 Specifies the Edit Memory of the function generator.
attrActiveTwoMemoryRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_EMEM 0 Specifies the Edit Memory of the function generator.
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_EMEM1 1 Specifies the Edit Memory 1 of the function generator since AFG 31K firmware version 1.0.4.
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_EMEM2 2 Specifies the Edit Memory 2 of the function generator since AFG 31K firmware version 1.0.4.
attrArbWaveformHandleRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_EMEM 10000 Configures the function generator to produce a Edit Memory waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_EMEM2 10001 Configures the function generator with a Edit Memory 2 waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_WFM_EFIL 10002 Configures the function generator with a Edit File waveform.
attrBurstIdleRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_BURST_START 1 Configure idle state to start point.
TKAFG31K_VAL_BURST_DC 2 Configure idle state to offset.
TKAFG31K_VAL_BURST_END 3 Configure idle state to end point.
attrBurstModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_BURST_TRIGGER 1 Triggered mode is selected for burst mode.
TKAFG31K_VAL_BURST_GATE 2 Gated mode is selected for burst mode.

Discrete Value Actual Value Description

TKAFG31K_VAL_FM_INTERNAL_SQUARE 2 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's frequency with a square waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_FM_INTERNAL_TRIANGLE 3 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's frequency with a triangle waveform.

attrOperationModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_CONTINUOUS 0 Configures the function generator to produce waveforms continuously.
TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_MODULATION 1001 the function generator use a certain method to modulate output signal. Current instrument driver support the following modulation types:
- AM ( Amplitude Modulation )
- FM ( Frequency Modulation )
- PM ( Phase Modulation )
- FSK ( Frequency Shift Key Modulation )
- PWM ( Pulse Width Modulation )
TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_SWEEP 1002 Sets the instrument to sweep mode. You could use the following function to configure sweep mode parameters.

- tkafg31k_ConfigureSweep
- tkafg31k_ConfigureSweepEx

In place of using this function, you can set the following attributes:
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_START_FREQUENCY
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_STOP_FREQUENCY
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_HOLD_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_RETURN_TIME
TKAFG31K_ATTR_SWEEP_TYPE
TKAFG31K_VAL_OPERATE_BURST 1 Configures the function generator to produce a discrete number of waveform cycles when a trigger occurs.
attrOriginalModulationRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_MODULATION_AM 0 Configures the function generator to AM modulation type.
TKAFG31K_VAL_MODULATION_FM 1 Configures the function generator to FM modulation type.
TKAFG31K_VAL_MODULATION_PM 2 Configures the function generator to PM modulation type.
TKAFG31K_VAL_MODULATION_FSK 3 Configures the function generator to FSK modulation type.
TKAFG31K_VAL_MODULATION_PWM 4 Configures the function generator to PWM modulation type.
attrOutputModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_FUNC 0 Configures the function generator to produce standard waveforms.
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_ARB 1 Configures the function generator to produce arbitrary waveforms.
TKAFG31K_VAL_OUTPUT_SEQ 2 Configures the function generator to produce arbitrary sequence.
attrPMInternalWaveformRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_SINE 1 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a sinusoid waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_SQUARE 2 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a square waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_TRIANGLE 3 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a triangle waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_RAMP_UP 4 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a ramp up waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_RAMP_DOWN 5 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a ramp down waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_PRN 100 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a noise waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_EMEM 200 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a edit memory waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_EMEM2 201 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a edit memory 2 waveform.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL_EFIL 202 Configures the function generator to modulate the carrier signal's phase with a Edit File waveform.
attrPMSourceRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_INTERNAL 0 The carrier waveform is modulated with an internal source.
TKAFG31K_VAL_PM_EXTERNAL 1 The carrier waveform is modulated with an external source.

attrRefClockSourceRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_REF_CLOCK_INTERNAL 0 The function generator produces the reference clock internally.
TKAFG31K_VAL_REF_CLOCK_EXTERNAL 1 The function generator receives the reference clock signal from an external source.
attrSequenceJtargetTypeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_JTARGET_INDEX 1 Enables the sequencer to jump to an index set usingTKAFG31K_ATTR_SEQUENCE_JTARGET_INDEX.
TKAFG31K_VAL_JTARGET_NEXT 2 Enables the sequencer to jump to the next sequence element.TKAFG31K_ATTR_SEQUENCE_JTARGET_INDEX setting is ignored.
TKAFG31K_VAL_JTARGET_OFF 3 Enables the sequencer to turn off the event jump state. In this state, even if the event occurs, the sequencer ignores it.
attrSequenceJumpEventRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_EXTERNAL 1 Indicates trigger signal is external trigger
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_BUS 2 Indicates trigger signal generated by *TRGSPI command
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_MANUAL 3 Indicates trigger signal generated by manual press button
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_TIMER 4 Indicates trigger signal generated by internal timer.
attrSequenceJumpSlopeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_SLOP_POSITIVE 1 Indicates that the event occurs on the rising edge of the external trigger signal.
TKAFG31K_VAL_JUMP_SLOP_NEGATIVE 2 Indicates that the event occurs on the falling edge of the external trigger signal.
attrSequenceModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_CONTINUOUS 1 Sets sequence run mode to continuous.
TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_TRIGGERED 2 Sets sequence run mode to triggered.
TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_GATED 3 Sets sequence run mode to gated.
TKAFG31K_VAL_SEQUENCE_SEQUENCE 4 Sets sequence run mode to sequence.
attrSequenceWaitEventRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_EXTERNAL 1 Indicates trigger signal is external trigger
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_BUS 2 Indicates trigger signal generated by *TRGSPI command.
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_MANUAL 3 Indicates trigger signal generated by manual press button.
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_TIMER 4 Indicates trigger signal generated by internal timer.
attrSequenceWaitSlopeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_SLOP_POSITIVE 1 Indicates that the event occurs on the rising edge of the external trigger signal.
TKAFG31K_VAL_WAIT_SLOP_NEGATIVE 2 Indicates that the event occurs on the falling edge of the external trigger signal.
attrSweepModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_SWEEP_AUTO 1 Sets the sweep mode to auto. The instrument outputs a continuous sweep at a rate specified by Sweep Time, Hold Time, and Return Time.
TKAFG31K_VAL_SWEEP_MANUAL 2 Sets the sweep mode to manual. The instrument outputs one sweep when a trigger input is received.
attrSweepTypeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_SWEEP_LINEAR 1 Sets the sweep spacing to linear.
TKAFG31K_VAL_SWEEP_LOGARITHMIC 2 Sets the sweep spacing to logarithmic.
attrTriggerModeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_TRIGGER_TRIGGER 1 TRIGger is selected for Trigger Out.
TKAFG31K_VAL_TRIGGER_SYNC 2 SYNC is selected for Trigger Out.
attrTriggerSlopeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_TRIGGER_POSITIVE 0 Indicates that the event occurs on the rising edge of the external trigger signal.
TKAFG31K_VAL_TRIGGER_NEGATIVE 1 Indicates that the event occurs on the falling edge of the external trigger signal.
attrTriggerSourceRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKAFG31K_VAL_INTERNAL_TRIGGER 3 The function generator wait for a trigger from its internal trigger source.
TKAFG31K_VAL_EXTERNAL 1 The function generator waits for a trigger on the external trigger input.
